title: JUUT Salon Font
content:
Hey everyone,

This is the logo for an aveda salon in my area, and I’d love to know what font they’re using. I suppose the letterforms could be handmade... in that case does anyone know of a font with a similar T? Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201030045im_/http:/typophile.com/files/juut_5408.jpg)

 [‹ Lula magazine font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201030045/http:/typophile.com/node/43963 "Go to previous forum topic") [What is this typeface? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201030045/http:/typophile.com/node/43960 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Maverick18x

comments.content:
Hi Matt,  
you probably are right about ‘handmade’ – certainly adjusted for the sake of symmetry.

The only sans with such an ‘uncial T’ that I can think of is [Seebad](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201030045/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/seebad_std_ot_virtual/?sample_text=JUUT%20juut).

F
